reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My wonderfully thought provoking morning of sci-fi
reviews.reviewText: This was my first sci-fi novella. Certainly not my last. Exceedingly thought provoking. Well written, engaging and wonderfully imaginative!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Really well-written, compelling characters and storyline
reviews.reviewText: The writing is so engaging--varied, unexpected and fun details, great and realistic dialogue, with touches of humor throughout. From the very first pages, I already cared about the characters--smart, vulnerable/confident, passionate, and devoted to the greater good. The author also does a wonderful job of making complex science and math understandable, even to a tech T-rex like me. I also love the pinging of "homespun" and wider geosocial philosophy, written in such a low-key, totally non-pedantic yet impactful way. I found myself rereading and highlighting because they resonated so much, and said in ways I haven't seen before. Can't wait to read all the complete series!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great short sci-fi novella
reviews.reviewText: First Contact Last Resort by Singularitive Ranch is set in 2033 and tells the story of Computational Astrophysics Professor, Amelita Bloom and the consequences of a world altering, accidental discovery on her and her colleagues. This was a very fast read - I was totally caught up in the story. The author makes the science interesting, but approachable, even for someone like me that doesn't know much astrophysics. I can't wait to read the 2nd installment.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice short read
reviews.reviewText: Overall a decent read. Two items did not fly for me (spoiler!!) : The cliché revolt right out of today's news, and a fair amount of the science was iffy. I don't mind sci-fi inventing things to move the plot or take a direction, but when it becomes an unlikely option it does not work for me. But overall I enjoyed the read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars "First Contact Last Resort" is a Journey I want to go on!
reviews.reviewText: Prepare to be transported to a mesmerizing future in "First Contact Last Resort," a science fiction novella (the first in a series) that explores the profound implications of a discovery in 2033 of a future solar system flyby. The first contact with an alien civilization, uncovered after learning about this potential flyby, sets the stage for what will most likely challenge our understanding of the universe and humanity itself. As the implications of this encounter become apparent, the fate of our planet and our societal systems hang in the balance.The story skillfully weaves together a riveting narrative from the very first page. The pace is balanced, while keeping you on the edge of your seat with each twist and turn. The attention to detail is precise, painting a clear picture of potential technologies of tomorrow and teasing us about the intricacies of the human response to this unprecedented event.What truly sets "First Contact Last Resort" apart is the depth of its characters. Through their eyes, we witness the range of emotions that emerge from these initial events: wonder, skepticism, fear and ultimately, an unyielding determination to seek answers. The protagonists are relatable and multidimensional, making their current struggles and triumphs all the more compelling."First Contact Last Resort" is an absolute gem in the science fiction genre. Its concise yet impactful storytelling creates a captivating narrative that makes you yearn for the next installment. Whether you're an avid sci-fi enthusiast or simply looking for a tale that explores the wonders of the universe, "First Contact Last Resort" is a must-read. It will ignite your imagination and remind you of the boundless potential of human curiosity.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good starter to a series
reviews.reviewText: "First Contact Last Resort" (FCLR) by the Singularative Ranch is an enthralling science fiction novella that captivates readers with its exploration of humanity's potential for first contact. Reminiscent of Carl Sagan's "Contact," this book seamlessly blends scientific curiosity, suspense, and philosophical contemplation.Set in the not-too-distant future, the story unfolds in a world where technology has advanced, incorporating elements from our present decade and updating them to fit seamlessly into the narrative. This integration of familiar technology adds a sense of realism, making the events of the story feel plausible and relatable.The protagonist, Astrophysics Professor Amelita Bloom, is a brilliant scientist who stumbles upon a mysterious interplanetary transit event, As "Lita" delves deeper into deciphering the "event", she becomes increasingly entangled with Homeland Security, the FBI, and Theist-based protesters.The narrative is skillfully crafted, building tension and suspense as Lita and her team race against time to comprehend the importance of such an event and make crucial decisions that will shape the fate of both humanity and the new opportunity."First Contact Last Resort" successfully balances scientific accuracy and accessibility. The scientific concepts are explained in a way that is easily understood by readers (with charts and graphs) without compromising the complexity and intrigue of the story. The authors demonstrate a commendable ability to make complex ideas relatable and engaging, making this book accessible to both science fiction enthusiasts and casual readers.The Singularative Ranch has crafted an engaging tale of discovery, exploring the complexities of communication, ethics, and the vastness of the universe. Fans of thought-provoking science fiction will find themselves eagerly awaiting the next installment in this promising series. Cudos on the Cogg!

reviews.reviewTitle: A Refreshing Sci-Fi Blend of Science, Intrigue, and Emotion
reviews.reviewText: A captivating novella that effortlessly combines elements of science, technology, and character development. Set in 2033, the story revolves around UC Berkeley researchers who stumble upon a groundbreaking discovery with far-reaching consequences. In just 140 pages, Singularitive Ranch has managed to craft a thrilling and thought-provoking narrative that will leave readers eager for the next installment. This refreshing sci-fi read is highly recommended for those seeking a gripping and intelligent story.
